ticket.title: Implement determinism module with YAML canonicalization

implementation.summary:
Create the determinism module in apm2-core that provides foundational
capabilities for all compiler outputs: YAML canonicalization (sorted keys,
2-space indent), atomic file writes (temp -> fsync -> rename), and diff
classification (structural vs free-text changes).

files_to_modify.changes: Add pub mod determinism; to export the new module

files_to_create.purpose: Module root exporting public API for canonicalization, atomic writes, and diff classification
YAML canonicalization: sorted keys at all nesting levels, 2-space indentation, no trailing whitespace
Atomic file write implementation: write to temp file, fsync, fsync parent directory, atomic rename
Diff classification logic to distinguish structural changes from free-text field changes

implementation_steps.details:
Create crates/apm2-core/src/determinism/mod.rs with public exports for:
- canonicalize_yaml function
- write_atomic function
- classify_diff function
- DiffClassification enum (Structural, FreeText)
- AtomicWriteError error type

In canonicalize.rs, implement canonicalize_yaml(value: &serde_yaml::Value) -> String:
- Recursively sort all object/mapping keys lexicographically
- Use 2-space indentation consistently
- Remove trailing whitespace from all lines
- Use consistent quoting (prefer unquoted for simple strings)
- Ensure idempotent: canonicalize(canonicalize(x)) == canonicalize(x)

In atomic_write.rs, implement write_atomic(path: &Path, content: &[u8]) -> Result<(), AtomicWriteError>:
- Create temp file in same directory as target (for same-filesystem rename)
- Write content to temp file
- fsync the temp file to ensure data durability
- fsync the parent directory (required on some filesystems)
- Atomic rename temp file to target path
- On any error, clean up temp file if it exists

In diff_classify.rs, implement classify_diff(old: &str, new: &str) -> DiffClassification:
- Parse both strings as YAML
- Compare structure: keys present, array lengths, value types
- Define "free-text fields" as fields like description, summary, rationale (configurable list)
- If only free-text fields differ, return DiffClassification::FreeText
- If any structural field differs, return DiffClassification::Structural
- Handle parse errors gracefully (treat as Structural change)

In crates/apm2-core/src/lib.rs, add:
pub mod determinism;

acceptance_criteria.criterion: canonicalize_yaml produces identical output for semantically identical input
acceptance_criteria.verification: Unit test with YAML inputs that differ only in key order, whitespace, or quoting style - outputs must match exactly

acceptance_criteria.criterion: write_atomic never produces partial files on interruption
acceptance_criteria.verification: Unit test simulating write failures at various stages - target file either contains complete new content or remains unchanged

acceptance_criteria.criterion: diff_classify correctly categorizes structural vs free-text changes
acceptance_criteria.verification: Unit tests covering: key additions (Structural), key removals (Structural), type changes (Structural), description-only changes (FreeText), mixed changes (Structural)

test_requirements.description: Test YAML canonicalization sorts nested keys
Test atomic write creates complete file
Test atomic write cleans up on error
Test diff classification for structural changes
Test diff classification for free-text changes

notes:
This ticket establishes the foundational determinism guarantees required by all
subsequent compiler stages. The atomicity and canonicalization properties are
critical for reproducible builds and safe concurrent writes.

Key dependencies:
- serde_yaml: YAML parsing and serialization
- tempfile: Safe temporary file creation
- blake3 (optional): Content hashing if needed for verification

This module has no dependencies on other RFC-0010 tickets and should be
implemented first as all other CCP-related tickets depend on it.
